subtitle: chapter 27 found in a yoga school that
Ranchi
why are you averse to organizational
work masters questions startled me a bit
it is true that my private conviction
two times that organizations were indeed
Hornets nests it is a thankless task sir
answered no matter what the leader does
or does not he is criticized do you want
the whole divine China milk curd for
yourself alone my gurus retort was
accompanied by a stern glance could you
or anyone else achieve God contact
through yoga if a line of generous
hearted masters had not been willing to
convey their knowledge to others he
added God is the honey organizations are
the hives both are necessary any form is
useless of course without the spirit but
why should you not start busy hives full
of the spiritual nectar his counsel
moved me deeply although I made no
altered reply and adamant resolution
arose in my breasts I would share with
my fellows so far as lay in my powers
the unshackling truth I had learned at
my guru's feet Lord I prayed may thy
love shine forever on the sanctuary of
my devotion and may be able to awaken
that love and other hearts on a previous
occasion before I had joined the
monastic order Sri Yukteswar I had made
a most unexpected remark how you will
miss the companionship of a wife in your
old age he had said do you not agree
that the family man engaged in useful
work to maintain his wife and children
thus plays a rewarding role in God's eye
sir I had protested an alarm you know
what my desire in this life is to expose
only the cosmic beloved master had
laughed so merrily that I understood his
observation was made merely as a test of
my faith remember he had said slowly
that he who discards his worldly desires
can justify himself only by assuming
some kind of responsibility toward a
much larger family
the ideal of an all sighted education
for youth had always been close to my
heart I saw clearly the aired results of
ordinary instruction aimed only the
development of body and intellect moral
and spiritual values without whose
appreciation no man can approach
happiness
were yet lacking in the formal
curriculum I determined to find a school
where young boys could develop to a full
stature of manhood my first step in a
direction was made with seven children
at the Higa a small countryside in
Bengal a year later in 1918 through the
generosity of Sir Mahindra Chandra Nandi
the Maharaja of Kasim Bazar I was able
to transfer my fast-growing group to
Ranchi this town and by here about 200
miles from Calcutta is blessed with one
of the most healthful climates in India
the chasm bazaar palace at Ranchi was
transformed in the headquarters for the
new school which I called Brahma Chaya
Vidyalaya in accordance with the
educational ideal of the Rishi's
therefore most ashrams had been the
ancient seats of learning secular and
divine for the youth of India at Ranchi
I organized an educational program for
both grammar and high school grains
it included agricultural industrial
commercial and academic subjects the
students were also taught yoga
concentrations and meditations and a
unique system of physical development
Jagoda
whose principle I discovered in 1916
realization of man's body's like an
electric battery I reason that it could
be charged with energy through the
direct agency of the human will as no
action slight or large as possible
without willing man can avail himself of
his prime mover will to renew his bodily
tissues without burdensome apparatus or
mechanical exercises I therefore taught
the Ranchi students my simple yoga
techniques by which the life force
centered in man's medulla oblongata can
be consciously and instantly recharged
from the unlimited supply of cosmic
the boys responded wonderfully to this
training developing extraordinary
ability to shift the life energy from
one part of the body to another and to
sit in perfect poise and difficult body
postures they performed feats of
strength and endurance which many
powerful adults could not equal my
youngest brother
Vishnu Chara and gosh joined the Ranchi
school he later became a leading
physical culture in Bengal he and one of
his students travelled to Europe and
America giving exhibitions of strength
and skill which amazed the university
savants including those at Columbia
University in New York at the end of the
first year at Ranchi applications for
admission reached 2,000 but the school
which at the time was solely residential
could accommodate only about 100
instructions for days students was soon
added in the vidyalaya
I had to play father mother to the
little children and to cope with many
organizational difficulties I often
remember Christ's words verily I say
unto you there is no man that hath left
house or brethren or sister or father or
mother or wife or children or lands for
my sake and the gospel's
but he shall receive an hundredfold now
in this time houses and brethren and
sisters and mothers and lands with
persecutions and in the world to come
eternal life Sri Yukteswar had
interpreted these words the devotee who
forego is the life experience of
marriage and family and exchanges the
problems of a small household and
limited activities for the larger
responsibilities of service to society
in general is undertaking a task which
is often accompanied by persecution from
misunderstanding world but also by
divine inner contentment connected with
its philanthropic glory masha mission
one day my father arrived in Ranchi to
bestow a paternal blessing long with
hell because i had hurt him by refusing
his offer of position with the bengal
Nagpur Railroad Sonny said I am now
reconciled to your choice in life it
gives me joy to see you and misses
happy eager youngsters you belong here
rather than with the lifeless figures of
railroad timetables he waved toward a
group of a dozen little ones who are
taken at my heels
I had only eight children he observed
the blinking eye but I can feel for you
with a large fruit orchard and 25
fertile anchors at our disposal the
student teachers and myself enjoyed many
happy hours of outdoor labor and his
ideal surroundings
we had many pets including the young
deer who was fairly idolized by their
children I too loved the faun so much
that allowed it to sleep in my room at
the light of dawn the little creature
would toddle over to my bed for a
morning caress one day I fed the pet
earlier than usual as I had to attend to
some business in a town near Ranchi
although I cautioned his boys not to
feed the faun until my return one of
them was disobedient and gave the baby
deer a large quantity of milk when I
came back in the evening sad news
greeted me the little fawn is nearly
dead through over feeding in tears I
placed the apparently lifeless pet on my
lap I prayed piety to God to spare its
life hours later the small creature
opened his eyes stood up and walked
feebly the whole school shouted for joy
but a deep lesson came to me that night
one that I could never forget I stayed
up with the faun until two o'clock when
I fell asleep the deer appeared in a
dream and spoke to me you were holding
me back please let me go let me go all
right I answered in the dream I awoke
immediately and cried out boys the deer
is dying the children rushed to my side
I ran to the corner of the room where I
had placed the pet it made a last effort
to rise stumbled toward me then dropped
at my feet dead according to the mask
karma which guides and regulates the
destiny of animals
the deers life was over and it was ready
to progress to a higher form but but my
deep attachment would I later realized
was selfish and by my fervent prayers I
had been able to hold it in limitations
of the animal
from which the soul was struggling for
release the soul of the dear made its
plea in a dream because without my
loving permission it would neither not
or could not go as soon as I agree to
departed all sorrow left me I realized
and knew that God wants his children to
love everything as a part of him and not
to field elusively that death ends all
the ignorant man sees only the
insurmountable wall of death hiding
seemingly forever his cherished friends
but the man of an attachment he who
loves others as expression of the Lord
understands that a death the dear ones
have only returned for a breathing space
of joy in him the Ranchi school grew
from small and simple beginnings to an
institution now well-known in India many
departments of the school are supported
by voluntary contributions from those
who rejoice in perpetuating the
educational ideas of the Rishi's under
the general name of Jagoda satsanga
flourishing brand schools have been
established at Midnapore lakhs nor poor
and puri the Ranchi headquarters
maintains the medical department where
medicines and the service of doctors are
supplied freely to the poor locality the
number treated has averaged more than
18,000 persons a year the vidyalaya has
made its mark to an Indian competitive
sports and in the scholastic field where
many Ranchi alumni have distinguished
themselves in later university life the
school now in its 28th year and the
center of many activities has been
honored by visits of eminent men from
the east and west one of the earliest
great figures to inspect the vidyalaya
in its first year was swami Pranab
ananda the Banaras saint with two bodies
as the great master viewed the
picturesque outdoor classes held under
the trees and saw in the evening the
young boys were sitting motionless for
hours in yoga meditation he was
profoundly moved joy comes to my heart
he said to see that larium Ash's ideals
for the proper training of youth are
being carried on in this institution
my guru blessings beyond it
a young lad sat sitting by side ventured
to ask the great yogya question sir he
said shall I be a monk is my life only
for God
those Swami prep Ananda smiled gently
his eyes were piercing the future child
he replied when you grow up there is a
beautiful bride waiting for you the boy
did eventually marry after having
planned for years to enter the Swami
order some time after Swami Pranab
Ananda had visited Ranchi I accompanied
my father to the Calcutta house where
the yogi was temporarily staying prada
bananas prediction made to me so many
years before came rushing to my mind I
shall see you with your father later on
as father entered the Swami's room the
great yogi rose from a seat and embraced
my parent with love and respect
but about he said what are you doing
about yourself don't you see your son
racing to the infinite I blushed to hear
his praise before my father
the Swami went on you recall how often
our Blessed guru used to say bonnet
bonnet bonsai so keep up Kriya yoga
ceaselessly and reached the divine
portals quickly the body of Pranab
Ananda had appeared so well and strong
during my amazing first visit to him in
Banaras now showed definite aging though
his posture was still admirably erect
Swami ji inquired looking straight into
his eyes please tell me the truth aren't
you feeling the advance of age as the
body is weakening are your perceptions
of God suffering any diminution he
smiled and Jellicle II the beloved is
more than ever with me now
his complete conviction overwhelmed my
body and soul he went on I am still
enjoying the two Pensions one from Baga
body here and one from above pointing
his finger heavenward the saint fell
into an ecstasy
his face lit with a divine glow and
ample answer to my question noticing
that prana banana's room contained many
plants and packages of seed I asked the
purpose I have left Banaras permanently
said and I'm now on my way to the
Himalayas there I shall open an ashram
for my disciple these seeds will produce
spinach and a few other vegetables my
dear ones will live simply spending
their time and blissful God Union
nothing else is necessary father asked
his brother disciple when he would
return to Kolkata never again the saint
replied this year is the one in which
Larry mascha told me I would leave my
beloved Banaras forever and go to the
Himalayas there to throw off my mortal
frame my eyes filled with tears of his
words but the Swami smiled tranquilly he
reminded me of a little heavenly child
sitting securely on the lap of the
Divine Mother the burden of the year has
no ill effect on the great Yogi's full
possession of supreme spiritual powers
he is able to renew his body at will yet
sometimes he does not care to the
aging process but allows his karma to
work itself out on the physical plane
using his old body as a time-saving
device to exclude the necessity of
working out karma in a new incarnation
months later I met an old friend Sinanan
who was one of Pranab Ananda's close
disciples my adorable guru is gone he
told me in its sobs he established a
hermitage new rich cache and gave us
loving training when we were pretty well
acetyls and making rapid spiritual
progress in his company he proposed one
day to feed a huge crowd from Rishikesh
I inquired why he wanted such a large
number this is my last festival ceremony
said I did not understand the full
implications of his words Pranab Ananda
Jai helped with the cooking of the great
amount of food we fed about 2,000 guests
after the feast he sat at the hive
platform and gave an inspired sermon on
the infinite at the end before the gaze
of thousands he turned to me as I sat
beside him on the dias and spoke with
unusual force sana don t be prepared I
am going to kick the frame
after it's done silence I cried loudly
master don't do it please please don't
do it
the crowd was tongue-tied watching us
curiously my guru smiled at me but his
solemn gaze was already fixed on
eternity be not selfish he said nor
grieve for me I have been long
cheerfully serving you all now rejoice
and wish me Godspeed I go to meet my
cosmic beloved in a whisper prana
bondage a added I shall be reborn
shortly after enjoying a short period on
the infinite list
I shall return to earth and join Baba ji
you shall soon know when and where my
soul has been encased in a new body he
cried again sanidine here I kicked the
frame by the second Kriya yoga he looked
at the sea of faces before us and gave a
blessing directing his gaze inward to
the spiritual eye he became immobile
while the bewildered crowd thought he
was meditating in an ecstatic state he
had already left the tabernacle of flesh
and plunged his soul into the cosmic
vastness the disciple touched his body
seated in the lotus posture but it was
no longer the warm flesh only a
stiffened frame remained the tenant had
fled to the immortal Shore I inquired
where Pranab ananda was to be born
that's a sacred trust I cannot divulge
to anyone Senate and replied perhaps you
may find out some other way years later
I discovered from Swami
Keshav ananda that Pranab ananda a few
years after his birth and a new body had
gone to broader Yanam in the himalayas
